intro: Piper catripense, commonly known as the Catarina pepper or Catarina long pepper, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest and is characterized by its slender, climbing vines and small, elongated berries. The plant produces a pungent, spicy fruit similar to black pepper, which is used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a glossy surface, while the stems are covered in fine hairs. Piper catripense thrives in humid, tropical environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
